instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936 sometimes green light no power
threads.message:
hello I need help with this board, no antecedent damages, only sometimes green light no fan spin

neither turn on with smc bypass mode

some values:

ppbus is 1.0v
pp3v42 is 3.3v

threads.title: 820-2936 sometimes green light no power
threads.message:
First remove F7040 and check C7040 voltage.
If still 1V, then post U7000 basic voltages: 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.
Also check resistance (ohm scale) between pins 17/18 and 27/28.

threads.title: 820-2936 sometimes green light no power
threads.message: U7000 mode diode to ground I have continuity pin 17, 18 and 23,

threads.title: 820-2936 sometimes green light no power
threads.message:
Not sure what you've meant.
I asked about resistance between some pins, not to ground.

Why don't you post the "continuity" values you've got?

threads.title: 820-2936 sometimes green light no power
threads.message:
ok sorry

C7040= 1v

U7000

Pin1=0,35v
Pin2=0v
Pin3=0v
Pin9=0v
Pin12=0v
Pin13=0v
Pin14=0v
Pin15=0v
Pin17=0,53v
Pin19=0v
Pin20=0v
Pin27=1,3v

R - Pin17/18= 0,32ohms
R - Pin27/28= 20,1ohms

threads.title: 820-2936 sometimes green light no power
threads.message:
"Pin2=0v"
No need to check anything else then; fix that problem!
Start checking diode mode to ground there.
Bad R/D7005?

threads.title: 820-2936 sometimes green light no power
threads.message:
nice my problem is with D7005

now I have Pin2=16,5v but don't turn on and don't have led green

now I detect continuity in pin 21 and Q7035, maybe I could have reballed the U7000 wrong and this pin21 is playing dough?

threads.title: 820-2936 sometimes green light no power
threads.message: Now is time to post voltage on U7000's above mentioned pins.

threads.title: 820-2936 sometimes green light no power
threads.message:
C7040= 1v

U7000

Pin1=15,5v
Pin2=16,5v
Pin3=3,95v
Pin9=0v
Pin12=3,44v
Pin13=3,4v
Pin14=0v
Pin15=0,03v
Pin17=0,58v
Pin19=5v
Pin20=5v(but count down to 0v)
Pin27=15v(but count down to 0v)

R - Pin17/18= 0,28ohms
R - Pin27/28= 20,1ohms

threads.title: 820-2936 sometimes green light no power
threads.message:
Check R/C7025.
Replace Q7030/35.
Keep F7040 out.

threads.title: 820-2936 sometimes green light no power
threads.message:
im replace Q7030/35 of other board with problem gpu

check C7025 value 556 and R7025 I check with 2 boards (once is work) 0,01 value scale ohms 200 and check for example R7022= 09,9

F7040 out a pin1 0.9v

threads.title: 820-2936 sometimes green light no power
threads.message:
"check C7025 value 556"
If you don't know how to check capacitor, replace it.
Be sure to get good solders...
